The camp is in need of maintenance
 
 Auschwitz asks Britain for help to preserve decaying death camp - Times Online
 
 Let it rot.
 
 The holocaust and WW2 is no longer of any great significance. Nazi's should be allowed to take company with other monsters of history such as the Vikings and Crusaders, abhorrent yet useful for fancy dress and sexual role-playing.
 
 I know no one that participated during the war and have less chance of doing so with each passing day, I have friends from all over the continent and I am happy to buy Japanese electronic goods
 
 If an academic or charity organisation wishes to upkeep the camp then let them but Britain has no responsibility to the camps past victims.
 
 Monuments can too easily be used to pay lip service to the past. What lessons are there to be learnt from Auschwitz, genocide and persecution have never been nor continue to be unusual. What does the camps existence offer future generations apart from guilt?

 Monuments can too easily be used to pay lip service to the past. What lessons are there to be learnt from Auschwitz, genocide and persecution have never been nor continue to be unusual. What does the camps existence offer future generations apart from guilt?

 
 A reminder that less than a century ago, people not unlike ourselves participated in the largest organised extermination of human beings in history. It wasn't a battlefield massacre, it wasn't just a work camps for political dissidents, it was a deliberate, industrialised slaughter of human beings simply because of who they were - Jewish, gay, Gypsy, black. Europeans need reminding that this isn't something that just happens in far away places like Cambodia or Rwanda. This happened in Europe, modern industrialised Europe. It can't be explained away by cultural differences or religious fervour, this is hatred, red in tooth and claw.
